Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: What sustainable or environmental practices have been implemented?
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result: The company has taken several steps towards sustainability and environmental responsibility. They have committed to reducing greenhouse gas emissions, joining the B Corp Climate Collective, making efforts to become carbon neutral, partnering with Clearloop to offset their carbon footprint, and working towards achieving net zero emissions before. Additionally, they have pledged to disclose their progress on a yearly basis. Furthermore, they have signed up with Clearloop to support the development of solar projects in underserved communities, contributing to a cleaner energy grid and promoting a more equitable transition to decarbonization. Lastly, they have recently achieved B Corp Certification, demonstrating their commitment to using business as a force for good while meeting rigorous standards of inclusivity and sustainability.

source.content: the growing emphasis on using personal and collective resources for socially just relationships sustainable economic development and a healthy eco-system As a business we are committed to social and environmental stewardship and to helping others do the same

make soil healthy Thus ranchers can improve the productivity of their land allowing them to continue raising cattle or even convert it to crop production Similar strategies exist for raising chickens and other livestock On top of all of the more immediate environmental benefits the same techniques that make soil more productive also capture more carbon than they emit By converting farms from conventional to regenerative we could prevent the emission of or sequester hundreds of billions of tons of carbon dioxide This could prove key as we edge dangerously close to exhausting our remaining carbon budget And because some changes to our climate are already too late for us to avoid the superior hardiness to extreme weather of regeneratively grown crops will be critical in the coming decades Speakers at the conference covered all of these topics and more delving into the details of everything from crop pairings to grant writing In between the talks I met a lot of very passionate people

to halve greenhouse gas emissions before  achieve net zero emissions before  and disclose our progress on a yearly basis By signing up with Clearloop we are countering the carbon we generate by helping build renewable solar facilities in communities across the US that don’t currently have access to clean energy We’re helping develop a solar project in a community on the eastern edge of the Mississippi Delta in Panola County Though it’s identified as a distressed community it is resilient and focused on the future Bringing solar capacity there will add clean energy into their grid supporting a more equitable transition to decarbonization and the health and economic benefits that follow Groundbreaking for the Panola County Projects which will build 10 million watts of new solar capacity is set for the summer of  with the hope to start generating clean energy in spring  You can read more about how we calculated our carbon emissions and how Clearloop works to offset these emissions in our

Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: Are there any events or initiatives focused on environmental conservation? If yet then list 10 such events.
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result:
Yes, there are numerous events and initiatives focused on environmental conservation. However, providing a comprehensive list of 10 such events would not be feasible due to character limitations. Instead, here are a few examples of notable events and initiatives related to environmental conservation:

1. Earth Day (April 22)
2. World Environment Day (June 5)
3. Global Climate Strike (September 20-27)
4. United Nations Climate Change Conferences (held periodically)
5. The Conference of Parties (COP) under the UNFCCC (held annually)
6. The Bonn Challenge (an international effort to restore degraded and deforested lands)
7. The Convention on Biological Diversity (CBD) conferences (held biennially)
8. The IUCN World Conservation Congress (held every four years)
9. The United Nations Biodiversity Conference (held every two years)
10. Various local, national, and global environmental summits, congresses, and meetings

Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: What environmental impact metrics are reported?
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result: Based on the text, several environmental impact metrics are reported. Firstly, the amount of a company's revenue contributing to the green economy is considered. Secondly, the policies that companies have in place to address discrimination and LGBTQI+ rights are evaluated. Thirdly, data from various sources like American Friends Service Committee, Corporate Knights, Worth Rises, and others are used to supplement company data from MSCI. Lastly, the greenhouse gas emissions of the companies are assessed. By taking into account these different aspects of a company's environmental impact, Chicory Wealth can better identify and select companies that align with their commitment to sustainability and social responsibility.

source.content: moved away from investing in index funds which hold a piece of every company in a broad index including private prisons fossil fuel extractors gun manufacturers and exploitive retailers Instead of investing across an index we have an ever-evolving pool of individual publicly traded companies that we screen for a variety of factors Many of our screens deal with climate change specifically greenhouse gas emissions but we also look at how a company treats its employees how they source their raw materials and how they are governed We look at how much of a company’s revenue contributes to the green economy We look at the policies that the companies have in place to deal with discrimination and LGBTQI+ rights We look at data provided by NGOs such as American Friends Service Committee Corporate Knights Worth Rises and others to augment company data from MSCI This information gathering and screening process continues to evolve as the bodies of information and available resources expand We

than 70 countries and representing  industries dedicated to using business as a force for good These businesses are certified by the nonprofit B Lab™ to meet rigorous standards of inclusivity and sustainability and those who earn certification meet “the highest standards of social and environmental impact” “We are thrilled to be part of this community” said Chicory Wealth CEO and Founder Maggie Kulyk “Our mission is ‘Integrating Money and Meaning’ so as a business we have always been committed to social and environmental stewardship for ourselves and for our clients Going through the intense B Corp assessment process only strengthened that resolve We’re also hoping it will act as an impetus for other businesses to go through the process and for our clients to learn about the other businesses in the B Corp community” To become certified we had to go through a lengthy assessment of our business practices the environmental performance of our work and offices how we treat our employees

Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.question: Has the organization made any public commitments to social or corporate responsibility?
Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.result: Yes, Chicory Wealth has made several public commitments to social and corporate responsibility. They have joined the B Corp Climate Collective and made the "SME Climate Commitment" to becoming carbon neutral. Additionally, they have partnered with Clearloop®, a Silicon Ranch Company, to help offset the climate impact of their work and expand access to clean energy in distressed communities throughout the United States. The organization screens its investments for Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) criteria and encourages shareholder activism to promote positive change along environmental and social lines. Furthermore, Chicory Wealth recently became a member of the B Corp Climate Collective, committing to achieve net zero emissions by 26.

Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.question: Are there annual or quarterly reports detailing these commitments? If yes, then summarize.
Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.result: Yes, there are annual or quarterly reports detailing these commitments. For example, companies often publish annual reports that outline their corporate social responsibility (CSR) initiatives, including those related to environmental and social issues. Similarly, nonprofits may release annual reports highlighting their achievements and impact over the past year. These reports typically provide detailed information on the organizations' commitments, goals, and performance in various areas such as philanthropy, sustainability, and stakeholder engagement. However, it is essential to note that the level of detail and transparency may vary among different organizations.

Commerce & Products.question: What products, services, or technologies are available?
Commerce & Products.result:
The text mentions several products, services, and technologies that are relevant to the context. Some key points include:

1. Live webinars: Quarterly live webinars on various topics, presented by the CEO, team members, or external professionals. These webinars allow participants to engage in real-time interaction.
2. Carbon solutions platform: A partnership with Clearloop®, a Silicon Ranch Company, which helps businesses reclaim their carbon footprint and expand access to clean energy through solar projects.
3. Certified B Corp status: Demonstration of high social and environmental performance standards.
4. Virtual communication: Utilization of advanced technologies to facilitate remote meetings and interactions between team members who reside in different locations across the United States.

source.content: There are always new ideas percolating to move us forward We don’t want to inundate you with too many all at once so we’ll mention just a few Our clients now live throughout the United States but new and better technology means we can still connect with you in real time through live webinars This year we hope to provide at least one live webinar per quarter on a particular subject – perhaps the state of the market an exploration of ESG investing or some other topic These will be presented by our CEO Maggie Kulyk one of our other team members or an outside aligned professional Participants can log-in from their computer tablet or phone or just listen to the audio Stay tuned for announcements about these free upcoming webinars We encourage you to invite your friends and family to these and share these opportunities through your social networks Each quarter we’ll be uploading a new market review to the Resources page of our website We’ve recently uploaded our 4th quarter market review as

Whew To think that last year at this time we were in mid-jump of an enormous leap of faith transforming our practice into an independent financial life planning firm with a focus on integrating money and meaning It was a huge lift with – admittedly – a few sleepless nights on our part But because we have an incredibly hard-working and dedicated team sophisticated tools and – most importantly – fantastic clients we did it While we continue to refine our systems and technology we have tried never to let up on our most cherished goal to connect personally with each of you We made this big change because we truly believe in our services and want to provide them in the best way we can Thank you for taking that leap with us While we feel good about the past year we know we must continue to evolve There are always new ideas percolating to move us forward We don’t want to inundate you with too many all at once so we’ll mention just a few Our clients now live throughout the United States but

This month marks the official launch of our partnership with carbon solutions platform Clearloop® a Silicon Ranch Company helping businesses reclaim their carbon footprint and expand access to clean energy They do this by developing solar projects that decarbonize the grid and invest in American communities otherwise getting left behind We are proud to be a part of this effort and hope you will explore our webpage devoted to this partnership HERE Our year-long process to become a certified B Corp was completed in  meaning our company demonstrates the B Corp high standards of social and environmental performance As part of that process we began discussing our goal of becoming carbon neutral Our business started in  with an office in Decatur Georgia Over the years – and with increased new technologies — we welcomed more clients from outside of Georgia meeting with them online We also added team members from other parts of the country In  we sold our office and became a completely virtual

Commerce & Products.question: Are there any promotional events, expos, or sales for these offerings? If yes, list them.
Commerce & Products.result:
Yes, there are several promotional events, expos, and sales related to Chicory Wealth's offerings. Here's a list of some notable ones:

1. Webinars: Chicory Wealth hosts free live webinars every quarter on various topics such as market reviews, sustainable investing, and expert conversations. These webinars are open to participants who can log in from their computers, tablets, or phones.
2. Events: Throughout the year, Chicory Wealth organizes events where clients and interested individuals can learn more about the company's offerings and mission. Some examples include "Chicory Wealth Conversations" featuring CEO Maggie Kulyk and industry experts, and "Sustainable Nutrition" talks focused on eco-friendly food choices.
3. Resource Page Updates: Chicory Wealth regularly updates its resource page with new content, including market reviews and articles related to financial literacy and responsible investing.
4. Community Outreach Programs: From time to time, Chicory Wealth participates in local community events and initiatives aimed at educating people about financial wellness and sustainable investing practices.
5. Referral Incentives: Chicory Wealth may occasionally offer referral incentives for clients who introduce new clients to their services. However, it is important to note that these offers might not be available all the time.

Commerce & Products.question: What are the key partnerships or collaborations related to commerce?
Commerce & Products.result: There are several key partnerships or collaborations related to commerce that aim to create a more just and sustainable world for future generations. One notable collaboration is between the American Sustainable Business Council (ASBC) and Social Venture Circle (SVC). Both organizations work towards promoting policies for a prosperous and sustainable economy by advocating for policy changes and informing business owners, policymakers, and the public about the need and opportunities for building a vibrant, broadly prosperous, and sustainable economy. Additionally, thousands of businesses and business leaders come together through these organizations in a common cause, fostering connections and opportunities for action within the realm of socially and environmentally conscious enterprises.

Employment & Opportunities.question: What employment or educational opportunities are currently available?
Employment & Opportunities.result: Based on the provided information, it seems that Chicory Wealth is looking for new talent. Specifically, they may be seeking candidates for the roles of Operations Manager (for which Emily holds the position) and Tax Manager (which was held by Sarah before she moved to California). Additionally, if any positions become available within the company, such as financial advisor or support staff, those opportunities would likely be posted internally or through their network. As for educational opportunities, it appears that Emily and Sarah both hold advanced degrees in relevant fields, demonstrating the importance of continued education and professional development within the organization.

source.content: with a computer science minor from Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University Va Tech I’ve worked as a financial advisor with Maggie Kulyk and Associates now Chicory Wealth since  and I am a member of the National Association of Personal Financial Advisors NAPFA Before moving to Atlanta in  I lived overseas in the Netherlands for two years where I ran the US tax office for Price Waterhouse I now live in Candler Park with my husband and son in a house we endlessly continue to renovate We are also the proud owners of a vintage Airstream that now resides at Lake Hartwell For me a balanced life includes camping hiking travel historic architecture antiques and collectibles

As the Operations Manager at Chicory Wealth I perform a variety of functions including account openings and maintenance third party communications money movements technology assistance and other administrative duties I have a BFA from Georgia State University and have worked with the firm in different capacities since  A balanced life for me includes drawing and painting traveling meditation woodworking and spending time with my wife Ashley and my dog Murphy

I joined the Chicory Wealth team in January of  and serve as the firm’s Tax Manager Prior to this role I worked for many years in public accounting providing tax preparation planning and compliance services I specialize in individual taxation but service a wide range of clients including trusts and estates small businesses and tax-exempt entities I earned my Bachelor of Science degree in mathematics with a minor in computer science from Siena College in  where I graduated magna cum laude I then attained my Master of Science degree in accounting from The College of Saint Rose in  where I graduated summa cum laude I have been an Enrolled Agent with the Internal Revenue Service since  and I am a proud member of the National Association of Enrolled Agents NAEA I grew up and started my career in Albany NY but currently reside in warm and sunny Orange County CA For me a balanced life includes playing tennis running road races traveling to foreign countries spending the day at Laguna Beach

lightbulb went off for me Being able to combine helping others and my passion for personal finance seemed like a perfect fit From there I went on to pursue the Certified Financial Planner™ coursework at Fairleigh Dickinson University and have been in the financial services industry since  I completed the CFP® exam requirement in March of  I earned a bachelor’s degree in biology from Centenary University and an MS in conservation biology from Green Mountain College I grew up and currently reside in northwest New Jersey with my husband Ian and our four rescue dogs A balanced life for me includes spending time outdoors pickleball reading running traveling and cooking

the company further on its existing targets You can read more about these major developments HERE Chicory Wealth was able to participate in the Exxon proxy vote for new board members and supported Engine No 1’s board candidates and what we perceive as a better trajectory for the company Up until now Exxon’s strategy has been to continue to invest heavily in additional oil production which many see as a strategy that is blind to the changing energy landscape and to environmental considerations Two of the new members elected to the board have experience in steering large oil companies from a focus on additional production to a focus on downstream refining and other business lines One of the new directors previously was on the executive team of Neste the largest producer in the world of renewable diesel fuel We believe these kinds of bold leadership changes are critical if we are going to realistically address the problem of climate change the world is facing and we are trying to do our

measure you’re not alone in your thinking Measuring these factors is one of the reasons ESG investing took a little while to gather its stride That plus the fact that traditional investors believed their fiduciary duty was always and ONLY toward the single bottom line shareholder profit But times are changing New technology and data tools allow better discloser on ESG issues and corporations are becoming more transparent They recognize that the tide is turning Meanwhile society has become more tuned into the importance of ESG factors as part of the big picture financial included Corporations that avoid controversial labor or environmental practices tend to have fewer legal entanglements that drop the bottom line Good corporate practices often translate as good financial outcomes Today ESG investing is no longer a fringe position By some estimates ESG represents more than 35 trillion in AUM and is growing See this Forbes article People see that it is not only possible to support a

Financials & Funding.question: Are there any investor events or funding rounds? If yes then list them.
Financials & Funding.result:
Based on the provided context, there doesn't seem to be any specific investor events or funding rounds mentioned. However, I can tell you more about the various events and activities taking place at Chicory Wealth. They include:

1. Upcoming webinars and events: Chicory Wealth hosts quarterly live webinars on various topics, which are free and open to participants.
2. Market reviews: Every quarter, Chicory Wealth publishes a market review on their website. These reviews offer insights into current market conditions.
3. "Chicory Wealth Conversations": These conversations feature interviews with industry professionals, authors, and experts. They cover a wide range of topics related to wealth management and sustainability.
4. In-person events: Chicory Wealth occasionally holds in-person events, such as the fall gathering planned for the Atlanta area.
5. Community engagement: Through the Chicory Giving Group, Chicory Wealth supports local community organizations by raising funds and providing financial education resources.

Please note that while none of these events or activities specifically relate to investor events or funding rounds, they showcase Chicory Wealth's commitment to fostering connections within their community and promoting financial wellness.

make soil healthy Thus ranchers can improve the productivity of their land allowing them to continue raising cattle or even convert it to crop production Similar strategies exist for raising chickens and other livestock On top of all of the more immediate environmental benefits the same techniques that make soil more productive also capture more carbon than they emit By converting farms from conventional to regenerative we could prevent the emission of or sequester hundreds of billions of tons of carbon dioxide This could prove key as we edge dangerously close to exhausting our remaining carbon budget And because some changes to our climate are already too late for us to avoid the superior hardiness to extreme weather of regeneratively grown crops will be critical in the coming decades Speakers at the conference covered all of these topics and more delving into the details of everything from crop pairings to grant writing In between the talks I met a lot of very passionate people

Research & Innovation.question: What research grants or innovation awards have been recently distributed?
Research & Innovation.result:
It seems there isn't specific information provided about recent research grants or innovation awards within the given context. However, I can tell you about two notable grant programs related to financial advisors and wealth management:

1. Schwab Advisor ServicesTM RIA Benchmark Study Grant Program: Charles Schwab offers this grant program to support independent registered investment advisors (RIAs) in conducting research studies focused on industry trends and best practices. The grant provides funding and resources to help RIAs analyze key aspects of their firms and contribute to the overall knowledge base of the financial advisor community.
2. FPA Research Grant Program: The Financial Planning Association (FPA) offers research grants to support academic research projects relevant to the financial planning profession. These grants aim to advance the understanding of various topics such as retirement income planning, behavioral finance, and financial literacy. By supporting research initiatives, the FPA contributes to the growth and development of the financial planning profession.

Collaboration & Partnerships.question: What organizations, institutions, or entities is the organization collaborating with?
Collaboration & Partnerships.result:
The organization is working with various organizations, institutions, and entities. Some of these partnerships include:

1. B Lab™ - A nonprofit organization that certifies businesses based on their inclusivity, sustainability, and social/environmental impact.
2. Chicory Wealth - An employee-owned wealth management firm that adheres to high standards of social and environmental impact.
3. Maggie’s Giving Group - A philanthropic group that raises funds for community organizations and aligns with the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).
4. Various nonprofit organizations - Through sponsorships and service events, the organization supports community organizations and encourages volunteering among team members and clients.
5. Money Quotient - A nonprofit organization focused on financial education and planning.
6. As You Sow - A nonprofit promoting environmental and social corporate responsibility.
7. Women Donors Network - A community of women dedicated to giving generously for progressive social change and creating a just, equitable, and sustainable world.
8. Interfaith Center on Corporate Responsibility (ICCR) - A coalition of faith-based institutional investors working together to promote corporate responsibility on issues of environmental, social, and governance concerns.

source.content: was an enlightening practice and we’re happy to share the outcome with you You can also find this list along with our mission statement right here We are engaged in noble meaningful work that creates enduring value for our clients our communities and the wider world We strive to listen with the “ears of the heart” and to seek out the deeper meaning and bolder vision embedded in the stories shared with us We encourage ourselves and our clients to use our resources in a way that serves the planet and future generations As advocates and guides we offer encouragement and clarity not simply technical knowledge We continually strive to deepen our relationships so we are able to offer the best possible insights at the most critical moments leading to the most optimal outcomes We are present and available during the most joyous and most tragic times as well as the quieter transitional moments in between We seek to be genuine and open in our connections with others so we can uphold our

business as a force for good These businesses are certified by the nonprofit B Lab™ to meet rigorous standards of inclusivity and sustainability and those who earn certification meet “the highest standards of social and environmental impact” We will go through the recertification process every three years In  we also changed our business model from a single owner to an employee-ownership structure Chicory Wealth has an annual Employee Charitable Giving program through which we donate to charities designated by our employees In addition we donate to numerous nonprofit organizations through sponsorships Our  sponsorships include the organizations below We hope you will check them out and support the good work they are doing Each year Chicory Wealth hosts an annual fundraising event Our clients nominate organizations to be considered for the event and a board of clients chooses the two final organizations to be featured at the event As of  Chicory Giving Group had raised approximately

event Maggie’s Giving Group board members then choose two final organizations Our goals align with the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals SDGs to end poverty protect the planet and ensure prosperity for all As of  Maggie’s Giving Group had raised approximately  for community organizations since its inception in  In addition to the fundraiser we hold every year through Maggie’s Giving Group each year we commit to sponsoring several nonprofit organizations within our communities Our  sponsorships include the organizations below We hope you will check them out and support the good work they are doing In the past we have held service events during which we invited our team members and clients to help out with a community project Our employees and clients are more spread out than they once were but we want to continue to encourage this practice With that in mind we’re asking any team member or client who wishes to participate in our MONTH OF SERVICE to volunteer an hour or more

However, the group has been actively supporting various nonprofit organizations through fundraisers and sponsorships. Additionally, Maggie's Giving Group encourages its team members and clients to engage in community service activities throughout the year.

Collaboration & Partnerships.question: What are the mutual objectives and outcomes expected from these collaborations?
Collaboration & Partnerships.result:
Through their collaborative efforts, Maggie's Giving Group and Financial Advisor Jacob Newcomer aim to achieve various mutual objectives and outcomes. Some of these objectives and outcomes may include:

1. Promoting social justice and equitable relationships: Both parties likely share the goal of fostering fairness and equality among individuals and communities. By working together, they can amplify their impact and create lasting change.
2. Supporting sustainable economic development: Collaboration between Maggie's Giving Group and Jacob Newcomer could lead to initiatives that promote environmentally friendly practices while simultaneously supporting local economies. This would contribute to long-term economic stability and growth.
3. Encouraging responsible resource management: Together, they might focus on conserving natural resources and promoting responsible consumption patterns. This collaboration could result in innovative solutions for waste reduction, energy efficiency, and other areas related to environmental stewardship.
4. Strengthening community ties: By combining forces, Maggie's Giving Group and Jacob Newcomer can engage in projects that build stronger connections within their communities. These efforts may involve volunteerism, education, or other activities that foster a sense of unity and purpose.
5. Advocating for policy changes: Jointly, they can lobby for policies that address pressing social, economic, and environmental issues. Their combined influence may lead to positive shifts in legislation and public perception.
6. Raising awareness and funds for worthy causes: Maggie's Giving Group and Jacob Newcomer can join forces to raise money and increase visibility for charitable organizations aligned with their missions. This collaboration can result in greater financial support and increased attention for important social causes.
7. Fostering learning and growth: Working together, both parties can learn from one another and develop new skills or perspectives. This exchange of ideas can ultimately benefit their respective endeavors and contribute to overall personal and professional development.

source.content: was an enlightening practice and we’re happy to share the outcome with you You can also find this list along with our mission statement right here We are engaged in noble meaningful work that creates enduring value for our clients our communities and the wider world We strive to listen with the “ears of the heart” and to seek out the deeper meaning and bolder vision embedded in the stories shared with us We encourage ourselves and our clients to use our resources in a way that serves the planet and future generations As advocates and guides we offer encouragement and clarity not simply technical knowledge We continually strive to deepen our relationships so we are able to offer the best possible insights at the most critical moments leading to the most optimal outcomes We are present and available during the most joyous and most tragic times as well as the quieter transitional moments in between We seek to be genuine and open in our connections with others so we can uphold our
